c74object.name: hoa.convolve~
c74object.digest: An ambisonics zero latency convolution reverberation.
c74object.description:
hoa.convolve~
uses FIR and FFT filtering to apply reveberation on harmonics dependant signals. The zero latency convolution is optimized with the Gardner algorithm and uses the circular harmonics behavior to reduce the number of FFT convolution. The only argument is the order and the attribute's messages are explain in the "messages" subpatcher.

metadatalist.metadata: hoa.library by Julien Colafrancesco, Pierre Guillot, Eliott Paris.

attribute.name: buffers
attribute.digest: Bind buffer~ object's names with a list.
attribute.description: Bind buffer~ object's names with a list. hoa.convolve~ share the same syntax as the polybuffer~ object and auto-complete the name with the "all" message.

attribute.name: channels
attribute.description: The buffer~ object channels can be set with a list. hoa.convolve~ accepts the pre-message "all".

attribute.name: limits
attribute.digest: Limits the size of the buffer.
attribute.description: The size of the buffer can be limited with "limits" message and a list. 0 means no limit. hoa.convolve~ accepts the pre-message "all".

attribute.name: offsets
attribute.digest: The begin of the buffer~ objects can be ignored with the "offsets".
attribute.description: hoa.convolve~ is optimized for high order processing with the offsets attribute. It ignores a defined number of samples at the beginning of the buffers and then reduce the number of FIR filtering and small FFT convolutions. (accepts the pre-message "-1").

example.caption: hoa.convolve~ used with a small order is an efficient tool to reduce CPU usage. At first order, it computes only three zero latency convolutions and allows to output on an infinity of loudspeakers.
